multidimensional.title: Multidimensional Analysis
multidimensional.desc: Comprehensively analyzes 5 key factors: skills, experience, location, visa, and salary.

scoring.title: Accurate Scoring
scoring.desc: Accurately evaluates by applying weights to each factor, resulting in a matching score of 0-100 points.

recommendation.title: Personalized Recommendations
recommendation.desc: Sorts from highest score and prioritizes recommending the most suitable matches.

criteria.title: Matching Criteria Details
criteria.skill: Skill Matching (40%): Match between required and possessed skills
criteria.location: Location Matching (25%): Accessibility between workplace and preferred location
criteria.experience: Experience Matching (20%): Suitability between required and possessed experience
criteria.visa_salary: Visa/Salary (15%): Visa support and salary expectations

score_guide.title: Score Interpretation Guide

global_support.subtitle: One-stop support service for international students
global_support.description: From visa, legal, finance, telecommunications, academics to employment, receive all professional administrative support needed for life in Korea in one place.

visa.description: Consultation and application support for various visas including D-2, D-10, E-7

online_consultation.title: Online Consultation
online_consultation.description:
Professional counselors will help solve your concerns.
Feel free to request a consultation anytime.

visa_extension.question: How do I extend my visa?
visa_extension.answer: Visa extension can be applied for from 4 months before the expiration date. You can visit the nearest immigration office with the required documents, or we can help you apply through our visa support service.

bank_account.question: How do I open a bank account?
bank_account.answer: Visit a bank with your alien registration card, passport, and student ID. Our financial support service provides detailed guidance on foreigner-friendly banks and required documents.

part_time.question: How many hours can I work part-time?
part_time.answer: D-2 visa holders can work part-time up to 20 hours per week during the semester, and without restrictions during vacation. However, you must obtain a part-time work permit. For details, please refer to our legal support service.

visa_conversion.question: How do I convert to an employment visa after graduation?
visa_conversion.answer: You can convert to D-10 (Job-seeking visa) or E-7 (Specific Activity visa). Our employment support service provides detailed guidance on visa conversion procedures and required documents, supporting the entire process from job preparation to visa application.

page.title: Visa Support Service
page.subtitle: Consultation and application support for various visas including D-2, D-10, E-7

service_intro.title: Service Introduction
service_intro.description: We support all visa-related tasks for international students staying in Korea. From visa application to extension and changes, our professional consultants will help you.

d2.title: Student Visa (D-2)
d2.description: Regular course students at universities (graduate schools)
d2.feature1: Part-time work up to 20 hours per week during semester
d2.feature3: Can convert to D-10 after graduation

d4.title: Language Training Visa (D-4)
d4.description: Language institute trainees at university-affiliated language centers
d4.feature1: Part-time work not allowed (special permit required)

d10.title: Job-Seeking Visa (D-10)
d10.feature2: Part-time work allowed without time limit

e7.title: Specific Activity Visa (E-7)
e7.feature3: Can apply for F-2 permanent residence

application_process.title: Application Process
application_process.step1_desc: Choose from online/phone/visit consultation and apply.
application_process.step2_desc: Prepare necessary documents according to consultant's guidance.
application_process.step3_desc: We help you complete and review the application form.
application_process.step4_desc: We provide accompaniment service when visiting the immigration office.
application_process.step5_desc: Check the review results and receive your visa.

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.q1_question: When should I apply for visa extension?
faq.q1_answer: You can apply from 4 months before the visa expiration date, and we recommend applying at least 1 month in advance.
faq.q2_question: Can I change from D-2 to D-10?
faq.q2_answer: Yes, you can change to D-10 job-seeking visa after graduation. You will need a graduation certificate and job-seeking activity plan.
faq.q3_question: How do I get a part-time work permit?
faq.q3_answer: D-2 visa holders must obtain a part-time work permit from the immigration office. You will need a school transcript and enrollment certificate.

consultation.title: Consultation Request
consultation.description: Have any questions? Please inquire online and our experts will respond quickly and kindly.

page.title: Legal Support Service
page.subtitle: Legal consultation services for employment contracts, lease agreements, and more

service_intro.title: Service Introduction
service_intro.description: We provide professional consultation on legal issues that international students may encounter during their stay in Korea.
service_intro.feature1: Employment contract review and drafting support

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.q1_question: I didn't receive my part-time job wages
faq.q1_answer: You can file a complaint with the Ministry of Employment and Labor (☎1350) or proceed with a wage claim lawsuit through legal consultation.
faq.q2_question: I couldn't get my deposit back
faq.q2_answer: You can apply for small claims court or civil mediation by preparing the contract and supporting documents.

consultation.title: Legal Consultation Request
consultation.description: For complex legal issues, inquire conveniently online. We will respond after expert review.
